Row.Text: The river there is like our veins - the veins of the world.
One of the most spectacular, complex, but fragile ecosystems in the world.
Thou ever restless sea, 'God's half-uttered mystery,' where are all the ships that sailed so gallantly away?
I peered down, I took up the runes - screaming, I took them - from there, I fell back again.
The land is always stalking people. The land makes people live right. The land looks after us. The land looks after people.
Close to the western summit there is the dried and frozen carcass of a leopard. No one has explained what the leopard was seeking at that altitude.
We look up. For weeks, for months, that is all we have done. Look up.
There is one tree that speaks only to the austere mountain heads, to the mindful wind and the watching stars.
A vapor like an oven's fire boiled up for days from the depths of the sea, and the whole place burned like fire.
In the calm darkness of moonless nights; in the lone glare of day, the snows descend upon that mountain; none beholds them there.
The tourist should get another lens - see straight inside. Wouldn't see big rock then. He would see that Kuniya living right inside there as from the beginning.
Spring flowers fade in autumn; it is not for the bees to mourn.
You ask for what reason I stay on the green mountain. I smile, but do not answer.
